contents.contents: Stop for a few minutes to watch  the Durteint river (on your left).

In the Middle Ages, the river served several purposes: to colour the wool (its water gave a special dark blue hue to the wool, called “the ners blue”), to wash clothes in the various washing places along the river or its water was used by butchers, dyers and tanners.

question.contents: What alterations did the river cause?
choices: The ground had to be raised because of possible flooding
Elms had to be planted to reinforce the ground

explanations.contents: The town had to be raised to avoid flooding. In addition, elms had to be planted to consolidate the banks.
